text: Hi,  guys. Does hubl variables not work in CSS with internet Explorer? When I use it, it looks fine in chrome, but in Internet explorer it does not follow. When I inspect the element and look at the style it just says, background-color: ;
have you checked in chrome to see what the hubl tag is outputting
hubl is rendered on the backend
When I inspect in chrome, looks just as if it was a hardcoded hex value
<@UQERM7BLY> But I get this error message in the editor: Warning:`185:0HubL in your CSS or JavaScript won't be parsed, except for the module_asset_url function`
So I can see it works if i extract all the CSS to document instead of having it in the CSS section of the custom module... Is it the only way to use variables in CSS?
i dont think hubl will work in the css pane on a custom module.  it does on a css file, though.  if in a module, you will need to add to the html pane.

Im getting issue where the css files are being read as js files <https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?blog_listing=false&content_group_id=null&domain=undefined&portalId=3406853&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_file_path=Bill+Ragan+Roofing%2Ftemplates%2Fblog-post.html&updated=1591386715288&hsCacheBuster=7133>
